IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION IS A MUSEUM, EDUCATION CENTER, AND MEMORIAL TO THE VICTIMS OF THE HOLOCAUST.
IRS990.MissionDesc: HOLOCAUST MUSEUM HOUSTON IS DEDICATED TO EDUCATING PEOPLE ABOUT THE HOLOCAUST, REMEMBERING THE 6 MILLION JEWS AND OTHER INNOCENT VICTIMS AND HONORING THE SURVIVORS' LEGACY. USING THE LESSONS OF THE HOLOCAUST AND OTHER GENOCIDES, WE TEACH THE DANGERS OF HATRED, PREJUDICE, AND APATHY.
IRS990.Desc: THE HOLOCAUST MUSEUM'S MISSION IS TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A MEMORIAL TO THE MILLIONS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO PERISHED DURING WORLD WAR II AT THE HANDS OF THE NAZIS, AND TO CONTINUE TO EDUCATE AND ENLIGHTEN PEOPLE BY PROMOTING AND PRESENTING PROGRAMS ON REMEMBRANCE, UNDERSTANDING, AND PREVENTION. THE MUSEUM HAD 122,983 ONSITE VISITORS THIS YEAR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: WARREN FELLOWSHIP - CREATED TO BENEFIT PRIMARILY FUTURE TEACHERS, IS SUPPORTED BY THE WARREN FELLOWSHIP FUND. ITS PURPOSE IS TO DEVELOP A CORPS OF EDUCATORS WHO WANT TO LEARN HOW TO EFFECTIVELY TEACH ABOUT THE HOLOCAUST AND OTHER GENOCIDES. THE TEACHERS ATTEND A SIX DAY INSTITUTE DESIGNED TO IMMERSE THEM IN HISTORICAL CONTENT AND PEDAGOGICAL ISSUES RELATED TO THE HOLOCAUST AND OTHER GENOCIDES. EMINENT SCHOLARS PROVIDE HISTORICAL AND ACADEMIC CONTENT WHILE UNIVERSITY FACULTY, AS WELL AS HMH MUSEUM STAFF, PROVIDE PEDAGOGICAL CONTEXT. DURING THE WEEK, FELLOWS WORK WITH SURVIVORS OF THE HOLOCAUST. FOLLOWING THE PROGRAM, FELLOWS ARE INVITED TO PARTICIPATE IN NUMEROUS EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND OUTREACH OPPORTUNITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH - SERVED TEACHERS AND STUDENTS FROM VARIOUS SCHOOLS IN 2017-2018. MANY STUDENTS WERE IMPACTED BY THE OUTREACH PROGRAMS (E.G., DIGITAL CURRICULUM TRUNKS, ALL BEHAVIORS COUNT CURRICULUM, EDUCATOR IN MOTION, TEACHER WORKSHOPS) IN SUPPORT OF THE INSTRUCTION OF HOLOCAUST EDUCATION IN ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE, AND HIGH SCHOOL CLASSROOMS. THE CONCEPTS OF THE PROGRAMS ARE TO PROVIDE TEACHERS TOOLS (INCLUDING MULTIMEDIA TOOLS) THAT ARE UNIQUE TO HOLOCAUST EDUCATION AND, IN MOST CASES, COULD BE COST PROHIBITIVE TO TEACHERS AND SCHOOL DISTRICTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: SUMMER INSTITUTE - THIS PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO EDUCATE EDUCATORS AND WOULD-BE EDUCATORS, AS WELL AS STUDENTS FROM ALL AROUND THE WORLD, ABOUT THE HOLOCAUST. IT ALSO PROVIDES STUDIES ON OTHER GENOCIDES AND WAYS IN WHICH SOCIETY CAN CHOOSE NOT TO BE A BYSTANDER BUT, BE AN UPSTRANDER TO ENSURE THAT GENOCIDE CEASES AND IS NEVER REPEATED.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: NET SALES OF INVENTORY - 2013 AMOUNT: $ -19,270. 2014 AMOUNT: $ 27,543. 2015 AMOUNT: $ -3,327. 2016 AMOUNT: $ 57,663. 2017 AMOUNT: $ 29,502. PROGRAM SERVICE REVENUE - 2013 AMOUNT: $ 60,824. 2014 AMOUNT: $ 273,954. 2015 AMOUNT: $ 277,214. 2016 AMOUNT: $ 305,633. 2017 AMOUNT: $ 120,548. MISCELLANEOUS REVENUE - 2013 AMOUNT: $ 67,460. 2014 AMOUNT: $ 19,030. 2015 AMOUNT: $ 20,549. 2016 AMOUNT: $ 82,495. 2017 AMOUNT: $ 7,324.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MUSEUM'S COLLECTIONS ARE MADE UP OF HISTORICAL ARTIFACTS, WORKS OF ART, BOOKS AND OTHER ITEMS PERTAINING TO EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND CURATORIAL PURPOSES. EACH OF THE ITEMS ARE PRESERVED AND CARED FOR AND ACTIVITIES VERIFYING EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING CONDITION ARE PERFORMED PERIODICALLY. COLLECTIONS ARE NOT RECORDED AS ASSETS IN THE CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION. RATHER THEY ARE RECORDED AS AN EXPENSE IN THE PERIOD THEY ARE ACQUIRED. THE MUSEUM HAS NEVER SOLD AN ITEM FROM ITS COLLECTION. IN THE UNLIKELY EVENT THAT A COLLECTION ITEM WAS SOLD OR DISPOSED OF, THE PROCEEDS WOULD BE USED TO FURTHER THE MUSEUM'S MISSION.

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S COLLECTIONS AND HOW THEY FURTHER THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE: HMH COLLECTIONS CONSIST OF A DIVERSE ASSORTMENT OF ARTIFACTS, REQUIRING MULTIPLE CONSERVATION NEEDS. EXAMPLES OF THE MANY TYPES OF OBJECTS THEY CARE FOR ARE: A 1942 GERMAN RAILCAR AND DANISH BOAT WHICH RESIDE OUTDOORS; PAINTINGS AND WORK ON PAPER MADE BY HOLOCAUST SURVIVORS; DAGGERS, BAYONETS, AND SCULPTURE; CERAMIC DISHWARE AND SILVER MEMORABILIA ITEMS; LEATHER SHOES AND HOLSTERS, UNIFORMS, HATS, AND HANDMADE TABLECLOTHS; ORIGINAL BRICKS FROM WARSAW GHETTO; MICROFILM AND AV MATERIALS; AND NUMEROUS BOOKS, FLAT PAPER AND ARCHIVAL ITEMS, PHOTOGRAPHS, MANUSCRIPTS ARCHIVES AND TWO TORAH SCROLLS. THE HMH COLLECTIONS ARE USED TO EDUCATE PEOPLE ON THE HOLOCAUST AND OTHER GENOCIDES AS WELL AS TEACH THE DANGERS OF HATRED, PREJUDICE AND APATHY.

INTENDED USES OF ENDOWMENT FUND: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO SUPPORT THE ACTIVITIES OF HOLOCAUST MUSEUM HOUSTON INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING: EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, CONSERVATION, LECTURE SERIES, DOCENT PROGRAM, YOM HA'SHOAH PROGRAM, AND CHILD SURVIVORS.

HOLOCAUST MUSEUM HOUSTON RECORDS CHARGES FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WHEN THEY ARE CONSIDERED PROBABLE. BASED ON ITS EVALUATION, HOLOCAUST MUSEUM HOUSTON HAS CONCLUDED THAT THERE ARE NO SIGNIGICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
HOLOCAUST MUSEUM HOUSTON REPORTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS FOR NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS ACCORDING TO ITS RECORDKEEPING PRACTICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 REVIEW PROCESS - THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THEN PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION OF MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT OF CONFLICT - THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD MAKE THE GOVERNING BODY AWARE OF ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT SO THAT A DISCUSSION AMONG THE BOARD MEMBERS MAY TAKE PLACE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION REVIEW & APPROVAL PROCESS - HMH DOES NOT UTILIZE OUTSIDE SERVICES TO DETERMINE PAY STRUCTURES. CURRENT CEO SALARY IS BASED ON PRIOR SALARY OF SAME POSITION WITH ALLOWANCE FOR EXPERIENCE AND COMPARABLE SALARIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON ITS OWN WEBSITE. OTHER DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

CONTRACT SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 259,019. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 355,585. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 107,151. TOTAL EXPENSES 721,755. PHOTOGRAPHY: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 5,812. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 477. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 9,693. TOTAL EXPENSES 15,982.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

HOLOCAUST MUSEUM HOUSTON ("MUSEUM") AND HOLOCAUST MUSEUM HOUSTON FOUNDATION ("FOUNDATION") ARE NOT "RELATED" ENTITIES MEETING THE TAX DEFINITIONS OF CONTROL FOR A PARENT/SUBSIDIARY, BROTHER/SISTER, OR SUPPORTING/SUPPORTED RELATIONSHIP. THE MAJORITY OF BOARD OF THE DIRECTORS OF THE FOUNDATION IS SEPARATE FROM, NOT APPOINTED BY, AND NOT AFFILIATED WITH THE MUSEUM BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FOUNDATION BOARD SHALL CONSIST OF A MINIMUM OF 12 AND A MAXIMUM OF 17 MEMBERS, ONLY 3 OF WHICH ARE THE CHAIRMAN OF THE MUSEUM, THE CHAIRMAN-ELECT OF THE MUSEUM, AND THE TREASURER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE MUSEUM. HOWEVER, THE FOUNDATION OPERATES EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL OR RELIGIOUS PURPOSES IN CONNECTION WITH THE MUSEUM. DISTRIBUTIONS BY THE FOUNDATION ARE LIMITED TO THE MUSEUM OR TO ANOTHER QUALIFIED ORGANIZATION DESIGNATED BY THE MUSEUM. IN EFFORT TO FULLY DISCLOSE ACTIVITIES OF BOTH ENTITIES, SCHEDULE R, RELATED ORGANIZATIONS AND UNRELATED PARTNERSHIPS, HAS BEEN COMPLETED ALTHOUGH THE ENTITIES DO NOT MEET THE TAX DEFINITION OF "RELATED OR "CONTROLLED." THIS TAX PRESENTATION IS IN AGREEMENT WITH THE AUDIT PRESENTATION OF A CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENT FOR THE TWO ENTITIES.
